title: Peak power demand declines 10% to 206GW as rains hit north India
description: After a heatwave, heavy rain reduced power demand, with peak falling to 206 GW from 250 GW. The India Meteorological Department predicts stable temperatures amid heavy rainfall. Southern regions saw a monsoon onset, lowering consumption. Neighbouring regions contributed significantly to power supply, aided by high coal stocks at thermal plants and increased CIL supplies.
